documentContentReferences.name: Schedule of Activities Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Multiple references to the Schedule of Activities (Table 1) for timing of procedures, assessments, and data collection.

documentContentReferences.name: US Screening Site Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the amendment summary to Section 8 for details on US-specific screening site procedures.

documentContentReferences.name: COVID-19 Vaccine Risk Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the risk assessment section to detailed COVID-19 vaccine risk information.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Multiple references to dose modification criteria for managing adverse events like elevated transaminases or anemia.

documentContentReferences.name: Adaptive Design Features Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Table 4 for details on adaptive design features.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Criteria Table Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: ALXN1840 Dose Modifications for Individual Participants
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Table 7 for specific dose modification criteria.

documentContentReferences.name: Exclusion Criteria Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from lifestyle considerations to exclusion criteria regarding blood donation.

documentContentReferences.name: Contraception Guidance Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Contraceptive Guidance and Collection of Pregnancy Information
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from lifestyle considerations to detailed contraception requirements.

documentContentReferences.name: Inclusion Criteria Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from lifestyle considerations to inclusion criteria regarding contraception start times.

documentContentReferences.name: Pregnancy Discontinuation Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from discontinuation criteria to the pregnancy section.

documentContentReferences.name: Discontinuation Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Discontinuation of Study Intervention and Participant Discontinuation/Withdrawal
documentContentReferences.description: References to Section 7 for QTc withdrawal criteria and follow-up procedures for discontinued participants.

documentContentReferences.name: Clinical Laboratory Tests Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 10.2 for the list of required laboratory tests.

documentContentReferences.name: AE/SAE Reporting Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Adverse Events: Definitions and Procedures for Recording, Evaluating, Follow-up, and Reporting
documentContentReferences.description: Multiple references to Section 10.3 for procedures on detecting, recording, and following up on AEs and SAEs.

documentContentReferences.name: Lost to Follow-up Definition Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to the definition of 'lost to follow-up' in Section 7.3.

documentContentReferences.name: Genetic Testing Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from biobanked sample section clarifying that samples will not be used for genetic testing.

documentContentReferences.name: Copper/Molybdenum Measurement Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Section 8.1.1 for details on copper and molybdenum measurements in various samples.

documentContentReferences.name: Pharmacodynamics Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from biomarkers section to pharmacodynamics section for details on copper-related assessments.

documentContentReferences.name: Analysis Populations Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Table 8 for definitions of the analysis populations.

commentAnnotations.text: Addition of text to the footnote to state that procedures specific to screening sites (only in the US) detailed in Section 8

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Clarify study procedures in the US to facilitate recruitment and lessen inconvenience for participants.
